dismissalText.commentary: Alok Kapali c Ojha b Gony 115 (96b 10x4 5x6 97m) SR: 119.79

dismissalComment.html: A stunning innings has come to an end by an equally stunning catch by Ojha at deep midwicket. Kapali had top edged a pull and Ojha rushing forward , dived with both palms outstretched and as the ball came down, the left hand slipped off the position but the right palm came under the ball. But the man of the moment is Alok Kapali. What an entertaining knock.

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c Dhoni b I Sharma 55 (67b 7x4 0x6 96m) SR: 82.08

dismissalComment.html: Super catch by Dhoni, diving to his right. It was down the leg side, Tamim tickled it fine but Dhoni intercepted it. Not a wicket-taking delivery and Ishant looks rather sheepish. Acrobatic effort by his captain, though. Tamim falls after scoring his 7th ODI fifty

dismissalComment.html: What a ripping turner. First international wicket. Lovely delivery. It drifted in to the middle and leg stump line, gripped the surface and spun sharply past the defensive poke to crash into the top of the off stump.

headshotImage.caption: Mushfiqur Rahim headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim headshot

dismissalComment.html: Ojha picks his second wicket.  It turned slightly from short of length and Rahim saw the length and went for the cut but was done in there by the extra bounce. Dhoni takes a smart catch.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: 2nd catch for the debutant Ojha. This time at mid-off. Ashraful drove a full length delivery to left of Ojha but couldn't get the elevation that he wanted. Ashraful is livid with himself; bangs the bat on the ground before walking off. Nice little moment, though, for Gony; his first international wicket.

dismissalText.long: c Mashrafe Mortaza b Farhad Reza
dismissalText.commentary: Gautam Gambhir c Mashrafe Mortaza b Farhad Reza 90 (84b 10x4 1x6 134m) SR: 107.14

dismissalComment.html: Finally, a catch has been taken. Mortaza, the fast bowler, swoops low at midwicket to hold it. Gambhir couldn't keep the on drive down and ended up chipping it. But it has been another potentially match-winning knock from the left-hander.

headshotImage.caption: Robin Uthappa player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Uthappa player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Robin is cleaned up! Really full delivery, short of the blockhole, though, and Robin  is struck on the crease, stabs it off the inner edge to the stumps. He ended up walking into it after he had played the drive; the feet were glued to each other when he played the shot. The fielders get in a huddle and jump up and down!

headshotImage.caption: RG Sharma headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: RG Sharma headshot

dismissalComment.html: Shahadat takes out Rohit. Again the front leg movement got him into trouble. He pressed it too far across, had to bring his bat around the front pad, and hence, was in not great balance while trying to flick it and couldn't keep the ball down. Caught at midwicket. Bangladesh are on the ascent here.

headshotImage.caption: SK Raina headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: SK Raina headshot

commentTextItems.html: quicker, on the middle and leg, turned to fine leg for the single that does the job for India. Raina has hit 300-run mark in this tournament and India have registered yet another emphatic victory.

commentPostTextItems.html: Stay on for the quotes from the post-match ceremony.

Ash: "I would like to congratulate Alok Kapali for his brilliant hundred and also Tamim. Gambhir and Raina played well." On dropped catches: "They are trying their best and I think it's part of the game."

Man of the Match: Suresh Raina "I am really happy the way I have played these three matches. Gautham was playing very well out there and I just wanted to stay there and give him company. I decided to play my shots when the ball is in my slot."

Dhoni: "It was a tough game the moment we started as in the last 84 hours we have played 36 hours of cricket. I was disappointed some what with the fast bowlers as they bowled too full or too short. The spinners bowled very well. Raina's back to back centuries is some achievement." On dropped catches: "It's not only my team as you see most teams are dropping catches on this ground! Perhaps, it's because of playing back to back games. Ojha bowled really well, flighted and varied his pace. A very good debut. It's good sign that Sehwag, Gambhir and Raina have got runs but we need to keep it going and score in the final."
That's it from us. Thanks for logging on. Alvida!

commentTextItems.html: slower through the air, turning in from outside off stump, Raina goes back to push it through extra cover for couple of runs
wide down the leg side

on a length, around off stump, guided to backward point. He was looking to have a go at anything full or short, was in to his position but saw that this was a good length delivery and tried to take a single to third man but couldn't beat the backward point fielder

commentTextItems.html: bangs it short, on the middle and off, Raina doesn't do his half-duck, half-sway routine this time but stays adjacent to the line, gets on his toes and steers to third man
outside off stump, punched to the off side
Magnificent blow over midwicket. It was short of length and moving towards off stump but Yuvraj pulled it violently over midwicket boundary. Six no 96 in ODIs for Yuvraj.
fuller, on a length, slanted across Yuvraj who tries to lift it over covers but can't get wood on leather
hurls across a bouncer on leg and middle line, Yuvraj pulled it very well to deep backward square leg boundary. He got top of it really well and hit it to the ground
leans forward to drive a single down to long-on.

commentTextItems.html: floated full on the leg stump line, Raina doesn't connect with the swing across the line and they will take the leg bye
inside edges a pull to short fine-leg region
waltzes down the track and scythes a lofted delivery over long-off
shaped to slog sweep but saw the fuller length, tried to adjust by paddling it away, missed and it bobbed off his pad over Rahim's head
wide down the leg side
floated outside off, slog swept to deep midwicket where Reza fumbles but recovers quickly
on a length, around off stump, slanting away from Yuvraj who pushes it to point

commentTextItems.html: The bouncer hits him on the back. Knowing that Raina likes to sway towards off, Shahadat hurled the short one towards middle and off and Raina ducked and swayed but obviously was not enough to wriggle away from that bouncer.
fuller on the legs, turned to the on side

dropped by Reza at deep cover. It was supremely timed from Raina - who went back to smoke a full delivery - and Reza palmed it over his head like a football goalkeeper. Too much Euro 2008 on the telly these days.

dismissalComment.html: 2nd catch for the debutant Ojha. This time at mid-off. Ashraful drove a full length delivery to left of Ojha but couldn't get the elevation that he wanted. Ashraful is livid with himself; bangs the bat on the ground before walking off. Nice little moment, though, for Gony; his first international wicket.

headshotImage.caption: Alok Kapali player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alok Kapali player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: A stunning innings has come to an end by an equally stunning catch by Ojha at deep midwicket. Kapali had top edged a pull and Ojha rushing forward , dived with both palms outstretched and as the ball came down, the left hand slipped off the position but the right palm came under the ball. But the man of the moment is Alok Kapali. What an entertaining knock.

dismissalText.commentary: Gautam Gambhir c Mashrafe Mortaza b Farhad Reza 90 (84b 10x4 1x6 134m) SR: 107.14

dismissalComment.html: Finally, a catch has been taken. Mortaza, the fast bowler, swoops low at midwicket to hold it. Gambhir couldn't keep the on drive down and ended up chipping it. But it has been another potentially match-winning knock from the left-hander.

dismissalText.commentary: Robin Uthappa b Shahadat Hossain 2 (11b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 18.18

dismissalComment.html: Robin is cleaned up! Really full delivery, short of the blockhole, though, and Robin  is struck on the crease, stabs it off the inner edge to the stumps. He ended up walking into it after he had played the drive; the feet were glued to each other when he played the shot. The fielders get in a huddle and jump up and down!

dismissalText.long: c Farhad Reza b Shahadat Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma c Farhad Reza b Shahadat Hossain 22 (23b 2x4 0x6 28m) SR: 95.65

dismissalComment.html: Shahadat takes out Rohit. Again the front leg movement got him into trouble. He pressed it too far across, had to bring his bat around the front pad, and hence, was in not great balance while trying to flick it and couldn't keep the ball down. Caught at midwicket. Bangladesh are on the ascent here.

recentReportStory.title: Rampant India overwhelm Bangladesh
recentReportStory.subTitle: Bangladesh v India, Super Four, Asia Cup, Karachi
recentReportStory.summary:
Alok Kapali's dazzling 115 gave Bangladesh a fighting chance, but their
inability to hold on to catches meant that India breezed past another
stiff target
recentReportStory.credit: Dileep Premachandran is an associate editor at Cricinfo
